intro: Acourtia ovatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, ovate leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Acourtia ovatifolia is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
